meanings.def: to receive money, property, etc. from somebody when they die
examples: inherit something from somebody She inherited a fortune from her father.
inherit (something) He will inherit the title on the death of his uncle.
Does he know that she stands to inherit?
He stood to inherit (= was likely to inherit) property worth over five million.
She inherited some money from her mother.

meanings.def: to have qualities, physical features, etc. that are similar to those of your parents, grandparents, etc.
examples: inherit something He has inherited his mother's patience.
How many of these traits are genetically inherited?
inherit something from somebody She inherited a passion for music from her grandfather.

meanings.def: if you inherit a particular situation from somebody, you are now responsible for dealing with it, especially because you have replaced that person in their job
examples: policies inherited from the previous administration
I inherited a number of problems from my predecessor.
